parameters: ■　各変数の初期値設定・準備など
□　リリース形態に合わせて、専用スイッチをオン
□　ゲームを開始するための各種準備
各イベント初期値代入
attention ようこそ、ティッセルの街へ！
Before starting the game, we will make some initial settings.

First, there are two difficulty levels in this game. Please read the
explanation and choose one.
※体験版の時は、難易度選択をスキップ

...However, within the scope of the trial version, it doesn't make much
sense, so we'll skip it.

All events will occur, so both the dignity and humiliation routes can
be progressed.

'Sokunuki' is a difficulty level intended for those who aim to only
collect H-scenes.

Each initial value is slightly favored. However, the dignity route
cannot be progressed.
ask:難易度を決定して下さい。
----- 各初期値を低難易度用に再設定 -----
■　チュートリアルの再生を行う否か
For those playing for the first time, a simple tutorial is prepared.

At key points in the early stages, please choose whether or not to
receive a simple explanation from a dedicated character.
ask:専用キャラクターによるチュートリアルを…、
■　オープニングの省略を行うか否か
You have already cleared this. Would you like to skip the opening?
ask:オープニングを省略しますか？
■　オープニングの準備を開始
storeMemory 首都の商人に体を売る

＊Mysterious Sister - The trial version ends here. Sorry for it being
short.

＊Mysterious Sister - Once you leave the North District, it becomes
incredibly difficult to draw a line...

＊Mysterious Sister - That being said, we have prepared a lot of events
for the full version. Please look forward to it!

＊Mysterious Sister - ...But, it would indeed be lonely with just this,
so we'll give you a sneak peek of one H-scene.

＊Mysterious Sister - We've registered it in album mode, so feel free to
take a look if you're interested!

＊Mysterious Sister - However, it contains major spoilers, so if you
want to purely enjoy the full version, please quietly close the game.

＊Mysterious Sister - Ah... one last thing. Please note that save data
from the trial version cannot be transferred to the full version.
＊Mysterious Sister - Then, let's meet in the full version!
回想シーン設定用の備忘録
難易度制御用のテンプレート
※初回のみ。以降は専用メッセージ
＊Kati: There's nothing else to do but to ask around in this area....
